item.title: WTO | Hong Kong complains against US tariffs
item.description: Hong Kong will file a complaint in the World Trade Organization (WTO) in the face of the imposition of new tariffs by the United States to the products and services of that Chinese semi -autonomous region. "US measures are absolutely inconsistent with the relevant WTO rules and ignore our separate customs status," Hong Kong government spokesman said in a statement. The territory executive "will formally initiate procedures in accordance with the WTO litigation resolution mechanism against US irrational measures to defend our legitimate rights," he added. Last Thursday, Hong Kong's Secretary for Economic Trade and Development, Algernon Yau Ying-Wah, had already said the city was considering resorting to the WTO. Algrenon Yau condemned in a radio program the imposition of an additional 10 percent tariff on imports from the territory, classifying the irrational measure. "It is a disrespect for the region status as a member of the WTO and Autonomous Customs Territory," he said. "Washington made a significant mistake by imposing these tariffs," he warned, installing the White House to "approach the decision with prudence." The secretary said that over the past decade, the United States have registered a commercial surplus of more than $ 270 billion with Hong Kong, underlining the benefits of bilateral trade. In addition, he said that exports from the former British colony to the country represent only 0.1 percent of the total, suggesting a limited impact of new customs rights. Yau noted that in recent years, Hong Kong has diversified its markets, such as Middle East, Southeast Asia and Central Europe, to mitigate “the repercussions of geopolitics”, allowing local companies to adjust export strategies.

item.title: Tourism | Per capita expense of visitors fell 14.6% in 2024
item.description: Over the past year, the per capita expense of visitors was 2,157 patacas, 14.6 percent, compared to 2023, the direction of statistics and census services revealed on Friday. If we analyze the difference between tourists and excionists, per capita expenses fell 8.2 and 12.7 percent to 3,884 and 691 patacas, respectively. However, in view of the annual increase in visitors in Macao in 2024 (23.8 percent), total expense outside the game grew 5.8 percent to about 75.4 billion patacas. DSEC indicates that visitors made expenses mainly in purchases (45.4 percent), accommodation (25.5 percent) and food (20.9 percent). Visitors who spent more per capital came to Macau attended shows and competitions (5,076 patacas) and conventions and exhibitions (4,323 patacas). Regarding consumer standards depending on the origin of tourists, highlighting the breach of the per capita expenses of visitors in the interior of China, who fell 18.1 percent compared to 2023, from Hong Kong (which a decrease of 13 percent) , South Korea and Thailand, with breaks of 33.8 and 22.7 percent, respectively. The only exception marked by DSEC was the per capita expense of visitors of Singapore (2,834 patacas) who grew 6.6 percent.

item.title: Photography | Religion and beliefs are the subject of a new contest
item.description:
Today starts the sixth edition of the Photography Contest promoted by Somos - Portuguese Language Communication Association, and this time has as its main theme the religions and beliefs that exist in the world of Portuguese speakers. “Man and the Divine” is the theme that candidates photographers should follow in the name of a “greater understanding of different ideologies” Image of António Mil-Homens
The sixth edition of the Macau Somos Association Photographic Contest! - Portuguese Language Communication Association (ACLP) wants to contribute to a “greater understanding of the different ideologies and creeds” between the regions where Portuguese is spoken, the organization told Lusa. “The question of understanding is closely related to ignorance that persists between the various ideologies and creeds in the countries and regions of Lusophony. Through photography, we intend to explore this cultural and religious diversity, ”said Somos's president! - ACLP, Marta Pereira. Under the theme “Man and the Divine”, the contest, which starts today and takes place until March 10, wants to “promote coexisting dialogue between religions or traditional local beliefs,” he noticed. "The images must capture the essence of devotion, contemplation and the profound connection between humanity and the divine or the transcendent," said the person in charge, adding that "it is fundamental" that the works "allow a historical contextualization, reflecting the various influences cultural and religious that shape spiritual experiences in different regions ”. Marta Pereira recalled that, in Macao, "the most practiced 'religion' is Buddhism, often associated with elements of other traditional Chinese beliefs and philosophies, such as Confucianism and Taoism." There is also a strong presence of "Christianity, brought to Macao by Catholic and Protestant missionaries." “If we look at Brazil, candomblé, a religion of African origin, is based on the worship of nature and its soul, and is therefore considered soul. In Timor-Leste, the population still remains rooted in the cult of ancestors and belief in spirits, ”he exemplified. To whom it is intended The competition, defines the regulation, is intended “to all citizens of the countries and regions of Lusophony or residents of Macau” with work done in Angola, Brazil, Cape Verde, Guinea-Bissau, Macau, Mozambique, Portugal, Sao Tome and Prince, Timor-Leste and Goa, Damão and Diu. The assessment of the candidate works is up to a jury chaired by Portuguese photojournalist in Macau Gonçalo Lobo Pinheiro and also featuring António Leong (Macau), Samba M. Baldé (Guinea-Bissau) and José Sena Goulão, Reinaldo Rodrigues and Alexandre Coelho Lima (Portugal). The three winning images will be awarded prizes worth ten thousand patacas, seven thousand patacas and five thousand patacas, and honorable mentions can be conferred. In addition to the pecuniary prize, the first place will be contemplated with the trip and stay in Macao -if not reside in the territory -to participate in the opening ceremony of the usual exhibition of Somos -ACLP, to be organized later this year, and in ' Locally organized workshops. In addition to the winning images, the exhibition completes other photographs selected by the jury “for its relevance or value” for the theme of the contest and “the purpose of the association of projecting the cultural dimension of Lusophony, as well as the role of Macao as a platform that unites China and the countries/regions of Portuguese Language ”, read in a statement from the Association.

item.title: Electric | Joe Chan says it is impossible to achieve inland goals
item.description:
Although last year 31.4 percent of the new vehicles recorded in the territory are electric, the president of Macau Green Student Union does not believe that the renewal of the Auto Park in Macau can achieve the objectives proposed by the interior
Environmentalist Joe Chan Chon Meng told Lusa that it is “absolutely impossible” Macau to reach the goal for electric vehicles in mainland China, from 45 percent of new sales by 2027. In early January, the Chinese government released a list of objectives Environmental, which includes a rise review of the previous goal for electric vehicles, which was 20 percent by 2025. In the second half of last year, the tramful ones represented more than half of the sales of new vehicles, according to data from the China passenger automobiles association. In Macao, 31.4 percent of the new vehicles recorded in 2024 were electric, according to official data. But the president of Macau Green Student Union stressed that fossil -powered vehicles “continue to represent a great proportion” of the territory park. At the end of December, Macau had a total of 253,182 vehicles, of which 12,302 vehicles (4.8 percent) were existing electric, according to the direction of services for traffic issues (DSAT). Still, Joe Chan stressed that in recent years, the government has implemented several measures to promote less polluting transportation, including the creation of more loading spaces for electric vehicles. Farther At the end of 2023, Macao had 2,100 electric charging places for light cars and 500 for motorcycles, indicated the direction of Environmental Protection Services (DSPA) on his portal. Authorities launched in 2023 a financial support plan for the slaughter of obsolete motorcycles and new electrical motorcycle replacement of a maximum of eight thousand patacas. According to DSAT, in 2024 Macao had 128,542 motorcycles, and only 3.5 percent were electrical, an increase of 1.4 percentage points over the previous year. Joe Chan suggested that authorities start by restricting heavy goods from goods, namely those used in construction, and public transport, "since Zhuhai [the city neighboring Macau] and border zones use natural gas and electricity." On Wednesday, DSAT officials told Radio Macau's Chinese channel that there are 929 new energy buses in operation, representing more than 92 percent of the total, while the proportion of more polluting buses descended to about 3 percent. As for taxis, there are only only electrical in circulation, representing about 11.9 percent of the total number, while the hybrid taxis represent about 86.2 percent of the total. "However, when it comes to highly polluting vehicles, such as trucks and heavy motorcycles, authorities have not yet defined a very clear calendar and deadline for their progressive elimination, so pollution [they cause] is high." , lamented the environmentalist.

item.title: Coloane | Old prison will be returned to the government
item.description:
The facilities and parking park of the old Coloane prison are being cleaned and will be returned to the Government of MSAR. Although there is still no plan for the reuse of the site, the government indicates that a purpose will be attributed to it in line with the “social development needs”
The change in the facilities of the Coloane Prison from Vila to Ká Hó will add new spaces in a territory zone that authorities nickname as “the garden of mashes”. In response to a written interpellation of Leong Hong Sai, the director of soil services and urban construction (DSSCU), reported the progress of the work, without revealing what is being planned to reuse the area. "The direction of correctional services is currently removing and transferring the existing useful materials in the former prison establishment, located in Colaane, on the Cheoc Van Road, Street of S. Francisco Xavier," said Lai Weng Leong. The DSSCU director added that after the removal of materials, "former prison facilities and parking parks for attached workers will be returned to the Government of MSAR." For now, Lai Weng Leong stated that a purpose has not yet been defined for the terrain of the old prison, but that the government “will attribute the corresponding, provisional and definitive purpose, in line with the Director Plan and the needs of social development, and must the ones respective concession procedures comply with the provisions of the land law ”. Beaten With a tourist bet on Lai Chi Vun's Naval shipyards, the government faces a transport problem and parking to Coloane, with the peninsula's public transport trips to take almost the same as a trip to Hong Kong. In response to the deputy of the Kaifong parliamentary bench, the government stressed the existence of six daytime careers and a night that serves the stops of the Coloane, Vila de Coloane and Campo/PSP -2 market. Regarding parking problems, the executive recalls that the “self-sile of the Concord Rotunda currently offers 198 places for light cars and 104 places for motorcycles and mopeds”, which is about half a kilometer of the shipyards. However, it is indicated that the direction of services for traffic issues and DSSCU will “study, in timely, the feasibility of creating a provisional parking park”, without indicating a possible location for that purpose. It is also mentioned that, “according to the director of the MSAR (2020-2040), Coloane is intended to promote the development of ecotourism and cultural tourism, with the creation of a walking area for nature and the green and resilient waist, based on the combination of natural resources, namely hills, sea and coastal lines ”.

item.title: Portugal Day | Marcelo in the celebrations in Macau
item.description:
Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa's passage has no date yet, but will fall into the celebration of Portugal's Day, Camões and Portuguese communities, in a year when official celebrations will take place in Lagos, Algarve, and then in Macao
The President of the Republic of Portugal, Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa, will mark in Macau the Day of Portugal, Camões and the Portuguese communities, June 10, although the dates of the visit are not yet defined. The information was advanced during the weekend by Radio Macau, and later confirmed by Alexandre Leitão, consul of Portugal in Macau and Hong Kong. “It is the confirmation of information that in the consulate many honors us and I think that honors the Portuguese community. It is a gesture of recognition by the President of the Republic of the relevance and dimension of the Portuguese community, which as we know is not restricted to the Portuguese immigrants, expatriates, Portuguese from Portugal, but all those who have Portuguese nationality and live in Macau and that are many. There are many tens of thousands, ”said Alexandre Leitão, in statements to the station. "I am sure that the Portuguese community is brothers in the same joy and satisfaction and that together we will know how to receive the President of the Republic with the gratitude that this gesture deserves to us," he added. Also to the Macau channel, Miguel de Senna Fernandes, president of the Macaense Instruction Promoter Association was pleased with the news. “Obviously it is not just a mere view, it is a visit by the President of the Republic, linked to a special day that is June 10. It is not every day that Macau receives a visit from the President of the Republic, although it is not the first time, ”he began by highlighting Senna Fernandes. “It is always good to know what the Portuguese state thinks about Macau, the presence of Portuguese culture […] beyond the discourses we are used to listening, it is important to know how the Portuguese state sees the presence of the Portuguese community in Macau. These are the questions I will ask if I have the opportunity to do so, ”he admitted. Miguel de Senna Fernandes also considered that Portugal politicians tend not to know what is happening in the territory. "The politician always says that he is aware of what is happening, but there are nothing aware of what is happening in Macao," he said. "It was good to elucidate us about the position of the Portuguese state in view of the presence of this community, from the radical community, Autocho de Macao," he said. Designated by Marcelo The information that Macao had been designated as one of the places where the June 10 celebrations will take place was released on the Presidency of the Republic of Portugal, through a press release. "The President of the Republic designated the city of Lagos as headquarters of the celebrations, in 2025, Portugal Day, Camões and Portuguese communities, extending the celebrations to the Portuguese community in Macao," was written in the statement. “For the organization of the celebrations, a commission presided by Dr. Lídia Jorge, writer, and who is part of the Chief of Staff of the Armed Forces, the Secretary-General of the Presidency of the Republic and the head of the State Protocol ”, Was added In December last year, Marcelo had stated that he was able to celebrate the last 10 June of his term with the Portuguese emigrant communities of places such as Asia Pacific, Australia, Macao or Goa. This will be the second visit of Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa as President, Macao, after a first ticket, in 2019.

item.title: Hengqin | Xia Baolong visited the in -depth cooperation zone
item.description:
The Director of the Hong Kong and Macau Affairs Office with the State Council, Xia Baolong, asked the Government of Masters to study Xi Jinping's speeches and use them as a reference for the development and diversification of the economy
Hong Kong and Macao's workst a director of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and the Hong Kong and Macau affairs office with the State Council, Xia Baolong, was on the mountain island from Friday to Saturday, under a “inspection and investigation” visit to the in -depth cooperation zone between Guangdong and Macau. During the trip to Hengqin, the Chinese leader nominated to the Government of Misrees that he should use the speeches given by Xi Jinping as political orientation at the 25th anniversary celebrations of the transfer. After visiting different industrial and traditional Chinese medicine parks, Xia Baolong presided over Saturday morning to a lecture. On this occasion, Xia Baolong stressed “that President Xi Jinping's important speeches define the course for the development of the deepened cooperation zone in Hengqin” and that “the government of the masters should understand the spirit of President XI Jinping's important speeches in -depthly understand. and realize them in the best way. ” In turn, the secretary for the economy and finance, Tai Kin IP, gave a presentation about the organization of the work of the Government of Masters for this year in the economic aspect. Official statements also indicate that there was an exchange of opinions on “the acceleration of the proper and diversified development of the economy of Macao, the promotion of the construction of the deepened cooperation zone between Guangdong and Macau in Hengqin and a better integration of Macau in the Great Bay ”. Tai's promises Tai Kin IP has promised that the economy and finance team will “effectively promote proper and diverse development of Macau economy and improve the effectiveness of economic governance, with a more open mindset, greater responsibility and more realistic measures”. The secretary also stated that the “area of ​​economy and finance will continue to improve the work on the definition of political measures on industrial development, to implement the general coordination, to optimize the business environment and to strive to capture investment and in the provision of business services ”. Tai Kin IP has ensured that Macau will increase investment in Hengqin, supporting "the development of diversified industries through the increase in investment of financial resources and the reinforcement of human resources guarantees." The secretary also pointed out that Macau will reinforce “proactivity in alignment with important national strategies”, including playing the role of 'infallible contact agent' in cooperation between China and Portuguese -speaking countries, and simultaneous implementation of initiatives' expand abroad 'and' attract foreign investment '”.

item.title: Tourism | Analysis says that Macau is increasingly a leisure destination
item.description:
The academics Pedro Steenhagen and Sofia Xiaoying have analyzed the Macao Tourism Industry, concluding that, increasingly, the territory is viewed as a leisure destination and not as much as a gaming land. The authors warn of the “long way to go regarding the promotion of sustainable tourism”
The Macao Tourism sector has changed in recent years and the visions of the tourists themselves as well, facing the territory as a place where one can walk and enjoy leisure zones, not as much as a game land. This is one of the conclusions of the “Tourism as A Driver of China's Cultural Soft Power: The Role of Macau and the Convergences Between The New Silk Road and the Greater Bay Area” [Tourism as the engine of China's Soft Power: The Role From Macao and the convergences between the new silk route and the Great Bay area], by Pedro Steenhagen, Fudan University, and Sofia Xiaoying Hou, linked to the Xi'an University of International Studies. Analysis of the tourism industry at MSAR is one of the chapters of the book “The Palgrave Handbook on China-Europe-Africa Relations”, recently edited. Thus, it is concluded that “the perception of the image of Macau by tourists has been changing in the last 10 years, being the more and more seen as a place of leisure and vacation in general, and not specifically or purely as a game center. ” It is also added that “the image of masters as a tourist destination is in transition, and people visiting Macao have greatly valued their unique cultural attractions, including their architecture and gastronomy, the result of the mixture of Chinese and Portuguese cultures and inheritances” . However, the authors consider that "Macau still has a long way to go regarding the promotion of effective sustainable tourism." It is understood that sustainable tourism “must fully take into account its economic, social and environmental impacts, addressing the needs of visitors, sector, environment and related communities”. In this field, the authors highlight, quoting another author, that "Macau has made efforts to achieve good grades in these and other stories, as the tourism industry of MSA has been undergoing a" silent revolution "since the beginning of the pandemic." It is also noteworthy that, worldwide, the International Tourism Organization has created some guidelines on sustainability, creating “an important framework of sustainable tourism”. For this, “five fundamental pillars were proposed to evaluate the sustainability of the tourism sector of a state”, such as “tourism policy and governance; trade, investment, data and competitiveness; Employment, decent work and training; Reduction of poverty and social inclusion; and sustainability of natural and cultural environments ”. The Silk Route The academics also analyze the role of the Macao tourist sector in the strategy of “a track, a route”, noting that the territory “has been gaining a prominent role in local, regional and external policies, being an actor capable of improving the Tourism Silk Route and streamline tourism in the Great Bay region ”. Macau is understood to make new contributions to the way China presents its culture, because “due to existing heritage and tourist products, it presents the Chinese culture to foreign visitors through a new, more diverse lens that goes beyond traditional” . Thus, tourists are allowed, “especially in the Lusophone world, [create] a better connection and understanding of the country through common historical and cultural bonds”. With regard to the Great Bay project, it is also considered that both this region and the territory of Macao have “actively integrated the tourism development strategies in the BRI frame”, ie “Belt and Road Initiative”, English designation for “a track, a route”. Macao has “a diverse and distinct range of tourist resources, such as the arts, history, constructions and religious traditions, gastronomy, sport, museums, among others”, and local authorities have sought, according to the authors, “Mark its tourist industry, promoting 'Tourism+' with transfronic cooperation in the scope of bri”. The idea is to “create an image of Macau as a city with diverse cultures, integrating the sectors of tourism, entertainment, culture, sports, business, conventions and exhibitions, health care, recreation, technology and big events”. IMPROVEMENTS ON COURSE Pedro Steenhagen and Sofia Xiaoying Hou understand that the Macao government “has been trying to improve cultural soft power and increasing tourist attractiveness through product development, facilities improvement and advertising”, and “projects to improve Facilities such as hotels, restaurants, transport and digital tours. ” The example of two digital pathways created by the Cultural Institute, namely, in 2021, “The House of the Family of Zheng Guanying” and also “Fortaleza da Guia”. Moreover, authorities have created several interactive platforms using increased virtual reality. Despite all the efforts pointed out to the local authorities, it is understood that "masters still have an unexplored potential to reinforce cultural ties between China and Portuguese-speaking countries, and this decade may present great opportunities in this regard." The tourist bet In this chapter, the authors also look at the positioning of tourism in the initiative “a track, a route” by Beijing, given that “China has been increasingly paying attention to the need to expand its cultural soft power , both regional and global. ” Thus, the country "has formulated several cultural development plans associated with" a track, a route "and the area of ​​the great bay, and tourism has constantly appeared as an essential element of its global strategy.” In the country "tourism has gained relevance, either as a means of improving international image and as a source of revenue." Only in 2018 “about 159 million visitors traveled to the country, which invested $ 155 billion in tourist infrastructure-a value behind the United States, but should become the first by 2028- once you saw the sector represents 11 percent of your total gross domestic product. ” The authors argue that “by connecting and increasing the dynamics between BRI [Belt and Road Initiative] and the Great Bay area, with an interesting effort on the diversification of Macao's economy and strengthening its tourist sector, as well as among the objectives. National and regional, China seems to be finding a way to boost tourism and reap the fruits in terms of cultural soft power. ” Thus, and in the long run, it is considered that the country “may not only grow the power of its narratives and culture, but also improve normative power and institutional positioning in the world scene, especially with regard to issues of governance ”. It should be noted that the book “The Palgrave Handbook on China-Europe-Africa Relations” is edited by Yichao Li, Jorge Tavares da Silva, Carlos Rodrigues and Francisco José Leandro, from the University of Macau. The edition is in charge of Palgrave Macmillan.

item.title: “I'm still here” highlighted in the Goya awards
item.description: Walter Salles's “I'm still here” won the category of best Ibero-American movie in the Goya awards in a ceremony that attributed “Emilia Perez”, a work of Jacques Audiard involved in controversy, the title of best European film. This is the first time that a Brazilian feature film has been recognized in Goya, and director Walter Salles, through a message read by Uruguayan musician Jorge Drexler, expressed gratitude for this “very special” award. He remembered, moreover, that the work is about the memory of a family “during the long night of the military dictatorship in Brazil”. The film recalls the story of former deputy Rubens Paiva, who was arrested, tortured and killed by the Brazilian dictatorship in 1971, and his wife, activist and lawyer Eunice Paiva, who had to resume family life with her children, and who tried to complain justice for the death of her husband, whose body was never found. The lead roles are played by Fernanda Torres and Selton Mello. Audiard Also this Saturday, "Emilia Perez", by French director Jacques Audiard, won the award for best European film. The music film tells the story of a leader of a drug cartel who fulfilled the desire to make the transition to women. item.title: Hamas | Five released Thai hostages return home
item.description: Five Thai hosts released by Hamas arrived in Bangkok yesterday, 16 months after they were kidnapped by the Palestinian Islamite group in Israel, international agencies reported. Agricultural workers were released on January 30, under the first phase of the ceasefire between Israel and Hamas, an agreement that aims to end the war triggered on October 7, 2023 by the Hamas attack on the soil Israelite. Watchara Sriaoun, Pongsak Tanna, Sathan Suwannakham, Surasak Lamnau and Bannawat Saethao landed at Suvarnabhumi Airport from Bangkok at 7:30 am, according to France-Presse news agency. The group was received by family members and Thai Foreign Minister Maris Sangiampongsa, wrote the EFE news agency. Speaking to the press, Sangiampongsa said the five are in good physical condition, although they continue to be evaluated. "Mental health is the next important issue," said the official, leaving thanks to the countries that contributed to the ceasefire in Gaza. Sombon Saethao, the father of Bannawat Saethao, said he was “very happy” for being able to meet his son, who will dedicate a traditional Thai ceremony. "I don't think I want him to be away from home," he added. On October 7, 2023, Hamas kidnapped 31 Thai, 23 of which were released before the end of this year and two declared dead in May 2024. It is believed that one last hostage of Thailand, detained in Gaza, is still alive.

item.title: Today Macau
item.description: Hong Kong will file a complaint in the World Trade Organization (WTO) in the face of the imposition of new tariffs by the United States to the products and services of that Chinese semi -autonomous region. "US measures are absolutely inconsistent with the relevant WTO rules and ignore our separate customs status," Hong Kong government spokesman said in a statement. The territory executive "will formally initiate procedures in accordance with the WTO litigation resolution mechanism against US irrational measures to defend our legitimate rights," he added. Last Thursday, Hong Kong's Secretary for Economic Trade and Development, Algernon Yau Ying-Wah, had already said the city was considering resorting to the WTO. Algrenon Yau condemned in a radio program the imposition of an additional 10 percent tariff on imports from the territory, classifying the irrational measure. "It is a disrespect for the region status as a member of the WTO and Autonomous Customs Territory," he said. "Washington made a significant mistake by imposing these tariffs," he warned, installing the White House to "approach the decision with prudence." The secretary said that over the past decade, the United States have registered a commercial surplus of more than $ 270 billion with Hong Kong, underlining the benefits of bilateral trade. In addition, he said that exports from the former British colony to the country represent only 0.1 percent of the total, suggesting a limited impact of new customs rights. Yau noted that in recent years, Hong Kong has diversified its markets, such as Middle East, Southeast Asia and Central Europe, to mitigate “the repercussions of geopolitics”, allowing local companies to adjust export strategies.

item.description: Ana Cristina Alves, coordinator of the Educational Service of CCCM 2025 January 29, 2025 To know more deeply the nature of wooden serpent Yin (乙巳蛇 yǐ sì shé), it will be convenient to analyze the stories related to this reptile of the sixth terrestrial field in close association with the female principle. It comes closely associated with the matriarchal divinity nϋwa (女娲 nǚwā) in the following myths “nϋwa creates humans” (女娲造人 nǚwā zào fench) and “nϋwa to the sky” (女娲补天 nǚwā bǔ tiān). In myths divinity arises alone, complete in itself, as a creative force, in the first myth, and as a regenerating and constructive force in the second, when mending the sky. As a mother of humanity, he did not remember being the following one of a visit to Earth, having first created the animals, but as he still felt deep loneliness, he decided to generate human beings: he could do so for containing powerful energy Soul, manifested in his quality of being heavenly, whose physical appearance was distinguished, because although he had a human head, he had a serpent body. It spontaneously generated with the help of the clay, that is, the Earth, an element to which it is indissolibly linked, either in the underground world, in wells, or in its agile climbing by the mountains and trees in an instinctive search for heavenly ascension. It is still this same figure with a serpent body that will replace order on Earth, when it plunges into chaos, following dignifying titanic forces, as in some versions it is affirmed that he has not wounded the sky after the god of northern Água do Norte, gonggong Founded his head against Buzhoushan (共工怒触不周山 Gònggōng Nù Chù Bùzhōushān), in an attack of fury against Northern Heavenly Emperor, Zhuanxu (颛顼 Zhuānxū), following the defeat inflicted by this. The way it has not taken the sky, the care it has put in raising its pillars, establishing them with the aid of stones, whose colors (green, yellow, white, dark and red) indicate the presence of the five elements, essential to Life, as well as the foundation of them erected on the paws of a black turtle, in order to ensure their longevity but even eternity; The precious aid he granted to humanity in the fight against beasts that in the bastard of collapse pulled, the works of drainage he then made, transformed this deity with the body of serpent into one of the foundations of Chinese religious culture and civilization. Note is the powerful ambivalence of this reptile, since it was not booming the body of serpent, Gonggong, the Folunum God of Water, is described with the same body of serpent, otherwise see how portrayed in “Gonggong throws the head against Buzhoushan: “Gonggong was a descendant of Yandi. It had a body of serpent, face and human limbs, as well as red hair, which indicated its fiery, energetic and adamant character ”(WANG, ALVES, 2009: 54). Serpents have poison, which heals as much as it kills, and can become, by their immense mutation capacity, into excellent humans as in the case of Banga Serpent (白娘子 Bai Niángzi), even in small dragons (小龙 xiǎolóng), when developing The generous and meditative facet, when connecting and advocating superior values, such as love, in the famous legend that came to us, for example, through Zhao Qingge (赵清阁) in 《白蛇传》 (Bai shé zhuàn). However, by their strength, capacity and intelligence can conflict as in the history of popular literature “discussion between serpent and the sun”, which might be able to find cultural equivalent in the Aesop's fable competition “wind and the sun”. In “The Serpent argues with the sun” (蛇与太阳的争吵) There is an obvious rivalry between the sun, representative of the yang male element, beautiful, bright, hot and powerful and the equally portentous serpent, considers themselves as much power from the earth. It challenges the sun, beginning a conflict between the power of the lunar mysterious and hidden forces, represented by the serpent, and the splendid irradiative brightness of solar energy. Finally the fable ends not with the victory of the sun, in the manner of Aesop, but with the need for recognition of complementarity, because without the alternation of night and day, sun and shadow, heat and cold the world, As the Chinese understand it (based on this tension harmony) would not be complete. Moral of History: If there was no sun, it would be the death of the earth, for it would plunge into an infinite night, if there were no snakes, it would be equally the end of the world, because there would be no agility, no ability to transform, plunging “everything that exists under heaven ”(天下 tiānxià) in immense rigidity and monotony. The serpent, as a sixth terrestrial field of the Chinese zodiac (十二生肖蛇 shí´èr shēngxiào) also symbolizes the ingenious animal, which, due to its powerful intelligence, is able to architect and carry out a well -calculated plan. This is proved by his biography upon entering the heavenly race promoted by the Emperor of Jade (玉皇大帝 Yù Hung dàdì). The serpent and the dragon used to be good companions and share the same aquatic spaces, when he learned of the emperor's intention to organize a competition so that twelve animals could command the stars and destinations of humans. Given the powerful intelligence of the reptile, he realized that he had no hypothesis or quickness to overcome the dragon, but as he knew how to make good calculations and better plans, he shared discreetly to the horse's back, without the one he was carrying a rival nearby From the goal it jumped to position herself in front of the equity, and so it was, both good friends to our day, since the always generous horse never charged her the ride. For the Chinese, the serpent symbolizes “a powerful and victorious mill” (以巧胜力 yǐ qiǎo shènglì). Another story draws attention to the importance of forgiveness in the ascetic process of the serpent towards transformation into a small dragon: “the serpent and the farmer” (蛇与农夫 shé yǔ knomfū). In a harsh winter, a certain farmer went with a stuffed snake. Studying her, he took him home, putting her in a warm place. When he recovered his strength instead of thanking him for being saved, he attacked the poor unprepared man with the aim of injuring him. This, avoiding in time being bitten and repressing the fury, called the reptile to reason with calmly, asking him if that was how he treated a friend who had saved his life. The serpent, played by the proven goodness of the farmer, never attacked him again. Moral of the story that the Chinese tell their children: goodness pays off and can save not only bodies as souls. The serpent symbolizes the divinity “guardian of the treasures of the earth” in 蛇守护宝藏 (shé shŏuhù bǎozàng), finding himself at the entrance of caves to watch over the infinite riches. The guardians are gigantic, endowed with a prodigious force, but also with deep and mysterious wisdom. Anyone who tries to penetrate these caves will not achieve it as much as they have. Only someone very special, of heroic spirit and armed with virtuous wisdom will pass the proof, providing access to the treasures of the earth, not for its own enjoyment, but for the benefit of the community and/or humanity.
